title: Using Email Templates in Hiver
content:
Email templates help you respond faster and maintain consistency. Here's your complete guide:

Creating Templates:
1. Click the template icon in the email compose window
2. Select 'Create New Template'
3. Name your template descriptively
4. Write your template content
5. Use placeholders for personalization:
   - {{customer_name}}
   - {{agent_name}}
   - {{company_name}}
   - {{ticket_id}}

Types of Templates:

1. Personal Templates:
   - Visible only to you
   - Quick responses for your common scenarios
   - Easily customizable

2. Shared Templates:
   - Available to entire team
   - Ensures consistent messaging
   - Requires admin permission to create

Using Templates:
1. Start composing an email
2. Click the template icon or type '//' to search
3. Select your template
4. Customize as needed
5. Send

Template Best Practices:
- Keep templates concise and clear
- Use friendly, professional tone
- Include all necessary information
- Leave room for personalization
- Review and update regularly

Advanced Features:
- Template categories for organization
- Keyboard shortcuts for quick access
- Template analytics to track usage
- Version control for shared templates

Common Template Use Cases:
- Welcome messages for new customers
- Order confirmation responses
- Troubleshooting steps for common issues
- Follow-up messages
- Closing/resolution confirmations
- Out-of-office or delay notifications

Tips:
- Create templates for 80% of your responses
- Always personalize before sending
- Use clear template names for easy searching
- Archive outdated templates instead of deleting
